title: I owe $23,000 in back child support. I recently finished college and got a job. Is there a way to pay without being garnished?
question: I live in California. I struggled to make it through college living off of student loans. I had an order to pay $20 per month but wasn't able to pay in the last year. I finally have a career and want to pay my arrears but I really don't want to be garnished 50% of my income due to other debts (rent, student loans, etc). I am determined to pay this debt off completely within 5 years and want to know how to go about setting up a payment arrangement with the Child support agency. My goal is to be able to make reasonable payments that will allow me to still survive. I have no current child support order. I only owe arrears. I also will be paying money to my child's mother. Thank you in advance.
question_tags: Child support,Bankruptcy,Debt,Nondischargeable debt and child support,Bankruptcy and debt,Getting child support,Child support agreements,Finances and child support,Determining child support payments,Child support arrears,Child support enforcement,Family law
answers:
First of all, you need to check with a local experienced family law attorney.

Second, the agency may work with you to establish a payment arrangement, depending on the terms you offer.

Third, I do not understand why you will be paying money to the mother if you are not under an order to pay support. You really need to review these issues with local counsel.
